question: The example of non-ohmic resistance is: (a) copper wire (b) aluminium (c) tungsten wire (d) gold wire
The electric current is due to the flow of: (a) positive charges only (b) both positive and negative charges (c) negative charges only (d) magnetic field lines.
Eureka has \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ temperature co-efficient of resistance. (a) almost zero (b) negative (c) positive (d) none of the above

An electric fan and a heater are marked 100 Watt, 220 V and 1000 Watt, 220 V respectively. The resistance of the heater is: (a) greater than that of fan (b) less than that of fan (c) equal to that of fan (d) none of the above

The figure shown represents a part of a closed circuit. The potential difference between A and B is: (Diagram shows a 3A current source, a 3V battery with 1$\Omega$ internal resistance, and a 6$\Omega$ resistor) (a) 24 V (b) 18 V (c) 0 V (d) 6 V
The capacitance of a capacitor is \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ relative permittivity. (a) directly proportional to (b) independent of (c) inversely proportional to (d) directly proportional to square of
A capacitor opposes: (a) change in current (b) both change in current and voltage (c) change in voltage (d) none of the above

A parallel-plate air capacitor is immersed in oil of dielectric constant 2. The electric field between the plates is: (a) increased 2 times (b) decreased 2 times (c) increased 4 times (d) none of above
Two capacitors have capacitances 25 µF when in parallel and 6 µF when in series. Their individual capacitances are: (a) 12 µF and 13 µF (b) 10 µF and 8 µF (c) 15 µF and 10 µF (d) none of above

A flux density of 1.2 Wb/m² is required in 2-mm air gap of an electromagnet having an iron path 1 m long. Calculate the current required if the electromagnet has 1,273 turns. Assume relative permeability of iron to be 1,500. (a) 1 A (b) 2 A (c) 3 A (d) 4 A
Determine the resistance R shown on the circuit: (Diagram shows a 35V source, a 600$\Omega$ resistor, a voltmeter reading 5V across a 1.2k$\Omega$ resistor, and resistor R)

Which of the following does not change when a glass slab is introduced between the plates of a charged parallel plate capacitor? (a) electric charge (b) capacitance (c) electric energy (d) electric field intensity

A 16 µF capacitor is charged to 100 V. After being disconnected, it is immediately connected in parallel with an uncharged capacitor of capacitance 4µF. Determine the potential difference across the combination: (a) 90 V (b) 40 V (c) 60 V (d) 80 V
An another unit of inductance is: (a) Wb T/A (b) V-s/A (c) H-turns² (d) All three are equivalent

A parallel-plate capacitor has plates 0.1 mm apart, a plate area of $1 \times 10^5$ mm², and a dielectric with a relative permittivity of 5. What is the voltage between the plates, if the capacitor has a charge of 5 uC? (a) 112.94 V (b) 183.23 V (c) 23.74 V (d) 75.53 V

Calculate the resistance of a copper tube with the external diameter of 10 cm, internal diameter of 9 cm, length of 2 m and resistivity of copper as $1.72 \times 10^{-8}$ ohm-m. (a) 21.72 micro-ohm (b) 22.05 micro-ohm (c) 25.76 micro-ohm (d) 23.09 micro-ohm
Hysteresis loss in a magnetic material depends upon: (a) area of hysteresis loop (b) volume of magnetic material (c) frequency of reversed of field (d) All the above
The magnetic strength of an electromagnet can be increased by: (a) increasing current in the solenoid (b) increasing the number of turns of the solenoid (c) Both (a) and (b) (d) None of above
Find the relative permeability of a piece of silicon iron if a flux density of 1.3 T is produced by a magnetic field strength of 700 A/m. (a) 1478 (b) 3291 (c) 1282 (d) 938
A coil of 0.02 mH is carrying a current of 1 A. If this current is reversed in 0.02 s, the induced emf in the coil will be: (a) 0.08 V (b) 0.004 V (c) 0.002 V (d) 0.02 V
